thread.section_title: Philly.com guide to entertainment news, music, nightlife and things to do in the Philadelphia area
thread.title: Our movie critic's weekend selections

author: Steven Rea,
title: Our movie critic's weekend selections
text:
Bridge of Spies Tom Hanks and Mark Rylance star in Steven Spielberg's taut Cold War thriller, a based-on-true-events spy-swap yarn set in New York and Berlin, steeped in paranoia and period detail. PG-13
He Named Me Malala Oscar-winner Davis Guggenheim's rightly admiring documentary of Malala Yousafzai, the Pakistani teen who was shot in the head by a Taliban gunman for her insistence that she - and all girls - had the right to an education. A polished and inspiring piece of advocacy filmmaking. PG-13
More coverage Tom Hiddleston, Jessica Chastain goth it up in 'Crimson Peak' The Martian Matt Damon gives a commanding, often darkly comic performance as an astronaut left for dead by his NASA crewmates when they beat a hasty retreat from Mars. With a waning supply of food and water and no means of communication, he has to figure out how to survive - and how to contact Mission Control - hoping they can bring him home. Stirring, science-rooted stuff from director Ridley Scott; with Jessica Chastain, Jeff Daniels, Kate Mara, and Michael Pe√±a. PG-13
